<@U3XTWA892|zol> has joined the channel
I tried to start a (test) cello stack on an Amazon AWS.  Everything seems to be running. How can I get into the dashboard?
<@U3XTWA892> FYI, <https://github.com/hyperledger/cello/blob/master/docs/dashboard.md>, The dashboard service will listen on port 8080. Thanks!
Thank you. It gives me (after authentication, admin, pass) a 404 - Not found.

Maybe the root of the problem is this: docker -H 0.0.0.0:2375 version – on the EC2 host machine gives me this:  Is the docker daemon running?
Otherwise it is running:

docker ps
CONTAINER ID        IMAGE               COMMAND             CREATED             STATUS              PORTS               NAMES
Maybe ubuntu 16.10 is not usable, only 16.04?
sorry haven’t tested on 16.10. you should make sure the docker daemon listen on 2375 for the worker nodes.

Thank you. The solution seems to be: there was an already running dockerd on the machine, using "/usr/bin/dockerd -H fd://", which is bad. Now I restarted it as "/usr/bin/dockerd -H <tcp://0.0.0.0:2375> -H unix:///var/run/docker.sock --api-cors-header='*' --default-ulimit=nofile=8192:16384 --default-ulimit=nproc=8192:16384"
Now the docker daemon listens on 2375, but it did not solve the "414 not found" error of the dashboard (on 8080).
If I send login credentials, would you please look at my virtual machine?

sorry, i can hardly access the aws due to network issues. you may first set up a master node without the worker nodes (the web ui should work with only a master node). Be sure to check the log using `docker logs xxxx` to see if there’s any error for the containers on the master node.
<@U196R0LA2|mikezaccardo> has joined the channel
<@U2KNX0F1P|jsalvachua> has joined the channel
Anyone at Hackfest working on Cello?
I have this error when trying to get into dashboard:
<http://pastebin.com/raw/7XKRDVY6>
<@U3AKCHR2P> I’m on vacation, and do not know if others can attend the Hackfest.
<@U3XTWA892> dear zoltan, could u tell ur detailed operation steps, will have a look. I follow the installation steps and it works in a fresh local vm.
I just followed <https://github.com/hyperledger/cello/blob/master/docs/deployment.md> . I think the problem is that for me the docker.service.d/override.conf does not work properly, because:

ps -aux|grep -i docker
root      1158  0.8  0.1 939776 53156 ?        Ssl  05:51   0:01 /usr/bin/dockerd -H fd://

If I try to start dockerd manually: /usr/bin/dockerd -H fd:// -H <tcp://0.0.0.0:2375> -H unix:///var/run/docker.sock --api-cors-header='*' --default-ulimit=nofile=8192:16384 --default-ulimit=nproc=8192:16384 &
[1] 7512
root@ip-172-30-0-4:~# no sockets found via socket activation: make sure the service was started by systemd
[1]+  Exit 1                  /usr/bin/dockerd -H fd:// -H <tcp://0.0.0.0:2375> -H unix:///var/run/docker.sock --api-cors-header='*' --default-ulimit=nofile=8192:16384 --default-ulimit=nproc=8192:16384
And if I try to start dockerd "officially" (service docker start), it gives the boring "/usr/bin/dockerd -H fd://"
I have an Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS.
<@U3XTWA892> can u try starting docker foreground like `/usr/bin/dockerd -H fd:// -H <tcp://0.0.0.0:2375>`
to see if there’s any error, and i also suggest u first see how to start docker at ubuntu 16.04. we need that as the environment setup. thanks
It gives me: no sockets found via socket activation: make sure the service was started by systemd
If I set up a basic (one-machine-run-everything) cello system, how can I determine the Worker_Node_IP? Is it 127.0.0.1 or some other tricky IP (e.g. 172.18.0.3)? Shall I use docker network ls?
basically, u need two separate nodes: master and worker, they will communicate with a connectable ip address, e.g., 192.168.x.x.

Thank you. Is there a documentation which shows starting a simple working example, step-by-step? In _deployment.md_ I can not find suggestions refering to the fact that "you should start master node this way" and "you should start worker node that way"; I believed that they are parts of the same host computer, run in different docker images.
I could solve this problem by removing /etc/systemd/system/docker.service.d/override.conf, and (!) creating a symlink in the same dir: ln -s /lib/systemd/system/docker.service docker.service

In docker.service I replaced "ExecStart=/usr/bin/dockerd -H fd:// " with "ExecStart=/usr/bin/dockerd -H fd:// -H <tcp://0.0.0.0:2375> -H unix:///var/run/docker.sock --api-cors-header='*' --default-ulimit=nofile=8192:16384 --default-ulimit=nproc=8192:16384". This way "docker -H 127.0.0.1:2375 version" runs fine, gives nice Client and Server data.

Though this error still remains when tryind to connect to the dashboard: _nginx         | 2017/02/04 22:15:05 [error] 8#8: *9 connect() failed (113: No route to host) while connecting to upstream, client: xxx,yyy,vvv.zzz, server: , request: "GET / HTTP/1.1", upstream: "<http://172.18.0.4:8080/>", host: "34.248.144.96:8080"_
I have running these docker images: <http://pastebin.com/raw/uem5nSPf> (_cello-dashbard, cello-restserver, yeasy/nginx, cello-watchdog, mongo:3.2_)
Why is this in log? _dashbard | ImportError: cannot import name 'Client'_
...as I see this is a known bug: <https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/CE-11>

<@U3XTWA892> Actually, the master node and the worker node are separate nodes, and should be put inside different host/server. I suggest u can try to first setup one master node, there you should be able to access the web ui. From your given msg, i suppose you start the containers successfully, but not the network routes. can u access the addr (you web ui addr) “<ttp://172.18.0.4:8080/>” from the master node directly?
Thank you. And where is the point where I give the Master node the address of the Worker node(s)? Now I installed Master node to ip-172-30-0-170 and Worker node ip-172-30-0-131.
How to do this? "And check the os iptables config, to make sure host ports are open (e.g., 2375, 7050~10000)"
"can u access the addr (you web ui addr) “<ttp://172.18.0.4:8080/>” from the master node directly?" > Yes, I can (even from command line via links).
My installation process can be seen here: <http://porgeto.hu/0/Installing_Master_and_Worker_node.mp4> as a screencast.
<@U2G0NE94P|vltech> has joined the channel

well, if u’re using docker-compose, then docker will handle those iptable rules, to map the external port to the container. I’ve looked at the CE-11, and guess there’s lacking of the docker-py lib, which should be installed automatically.
I wrote my experiences about importing Client here: <http://pastebin.com/raw/71pXcFF8>
thanks, zoltan, the reason is with latest docker-compose pkg, will submit a patchset to fix that.
<http://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/5559>
